title: Development of Mathematical Quality Standards for MOOC Programming Course Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic programming concepts, secondary-level mathematics knowledge (statistics, probability, equations), and foundational skills in T-tests and data analysis
context.additional_context: Enhances VR-based mathematics education course design competencies for pre-service and in-service teachers. Focuses on mathematical modeling for learning data analysis and evidence-based decision-making.

learning_goals: Explain the three quality criteria for MOOC programming courses (instructional design, technical standards, statistical validation) and apply data analysis methods using probability distributions and T-tests.
Use independent samples T-tests to analyze the statistical significance of needs differences between programming and non-programming learners.
Simulate effective lecture organization and mathematical culture-building strategies in VR environments, visualizing learning performance data through graphs.
Interpret learnersâ€™ interaction data using learning analytics tools and derive improvement strategies via mathematical methods such as regression analysis.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
